title: I have a problem and do not want to involve the police
about: The Neighborhood Council (formerly Neighborhood Crime Prevention Council) for beat 10Y exists as a forum to find community solutions to ongoing problems in the neighborhoods of Longfellow (North of 40th St) and Santa Fe. We believe in a holistic approach to crime prevention and work in partnership with the City of Oakland to address ongoing problems in our neighborhoods.   Monthly meetings will be attended by a Community Resource Officer (CRO) – a specifically-designated OPD officer whose position is funded by Measure Z. Any community member (lives, works, or worships) who wishes to regularly attend and participate in meetings is also welcome to join by signing up here. We will often have speakers from the city or community lined up for our meetings.
schedule:
NC 10Y meets on the 4th Wednesday of each month (except December and November). Any community member (lives, works, or worships) who wishes to regularly attend and participate in meetings is also welcome to join by signing up here. Our next meeting is on Wednesday, March 22, 2023 at 6:30 PM..  We are working to find a space to host hybrid meetings for those who would rather attend in person (if you have a space that is amenable to host a hybrid meeting, please email yates@duck.com).
  • Wednesday, March 22, 2023 at 6:30 PM
  • Wednesday, April 26, 2023 at 6:30 PM
  • Wednesday, May 24, 2023 at 6:30 PM
  • Wednesday, June 28, 2023 at 6:30 PM
  • Wednesday, July 27, 2023 at 6:30 PM
  • Wednesday, August 23, 2023 at 6:30 PM
  • Wednesday, September 27, 2023 at 6:30 PM
  • Wednesday, October 25, 2023 at 6:30 PM
Info: Our CRO is Officer Jason Kino (JKino@oaklandca.gov ) and the officer Sylvestre Triana (STriana@oaklandca.gov) is a helpful resource for Area 2 (North Oakland and Uptown)
info: There are several community-based organizations that are anti-police. The anti-terror project has a website and a hotline that I could not find in 5 minutes of searching their website. https://www.antipoliceterrorproject.org/ RJoy (a.k.a. Restorative Justice for Oakland Youth) operates a  hotline for mental health emergencies. The number is (888)752-2737 Please email yates@duck.com  if you have more information on community alternatives. We aim to be inclusive and holistic in our solutions to the problems that are facing the neighborhood. Finally, don’t let perfect be the enemy of good. Solve problems however best fits your style, but please do think about how we should best record what happens so we can create a common narrative for our neighborhood. There is no place for antagonism at NCPC meetings.
</ul>title: I have a problem that is not a crime against a person or my property.
